item.title: Papyrus
item.description: Welcome to Papyrus! Papyrus is my collection of notes on various topics, including distributed computing and finance. This began as a personal experiment and has since evolved into an elaborate system that works tirelessly in the background to help me remember things.

item.title: Zettelkasten
item.description: Overview It originates from a system of writing on index cards. These cards would be grouped into various boxes meant for a specific purpose. Each of these cards would be linked to other cards through an index number.

item.title: You And Your Research
item.description: Self Link: You And Your Research This is a talk given by Professor Richard W. Hamming, where he preaches 2 things - It is worth trying to accomplish the goals you set for yourself.

item.title: When to use Machine Learning?
item.description: Machine learning is an approach to learn complex patterns from existing data and use these patterns to make predictions on unseen data. Systems should have the capacity to learn.

item.title: Three Layers of Behavior Change
item.description: The Three Layers Change in Outcomes - What you get. Change in Process - What you do. Change in Identity - What you believe. Two Types of Change Outcome-Based - Focus on what you want to achieve.

item.title: RPCs and Threads
item.description: Threads enable the following - Concurrency Multicore Parallelism Convenience (periodic background tasks) RPCs and Threads We generally have an RPC service that listens for incoming ...

item.title: Thinking Traps
item.description: What we think about impacts our emotions. Hence, when emotional, our thoughts can be inaccurate. Thinking traps are false or inaccurate thoughts that we think are true, that make us upset.

item.title: The Three Fund Portfolio
item.description: Note This is specific to the US investor. The three-fund portfolio is popular amongst Bogleheads who are interested in a simple, lazy investment strategy.

item.title: The Psychology of Money
item.description: Morgan Housel’s The Psychology of Money uses real-life anecdotes to describe how people’s financial decisions are influenced by emotion rather than logic ...

item.title: The Little Book of Common Sense Investing
item.description: Successful investing is ALL about COMMON SENSE. A winning strategy is to own all of the nation’s businesses at a meager cost. This will capture the entire market’s dividends and growth.
